pull_request.title: Updated picnic to v2.2.
pull_request.body:
Updated picnic to v2.2. From the changelog:

- Fix Picnic2 implementation on big endian systems
- Add support for SHA3/SHAKE3 instructions on IBM z.
- Various small improvements and bug fixes.
- Remove LowMC instances with m=1.

pull_request.title: Updated picnic to v2.2.
pull_request.body:
Updated picnic to v2.2. From the changelog:

- Fix Picnic2 implementation on big endian systems
- Add support for SHA3/SHAKE3 instructions on IBM z.
- Various small improvements and bug fixes.
- Remove LowMC instances with m=1.

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for quantum-safe cryptographic algorithms

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -64,6 +64,17 @@ The following quantum-safe algorithms from liboqs are supported (assuming they h
 The following hybrid algorithms are supported only for L1 schemes; they combine an L1 quantum-safe algorithm listed above with ECDH that uses NIST's P256 curve:
 - `p256_<KEX>`, where ``<KEX>`` is any one of the L1 algorithms listed above.
 
+#### Signatures
+
+The following quantum-safe algorithms from liboqs are supported (assuming they have been enabled in liboqs):
+
+- `oqs_sigdefault` (see [here](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/wiki/Using-liboqs-algorithms-that-are-not-in-the-forks#oqsdefault) for what this denotes)
+- `dilithium2`
+- `dilithium3`
+- `dilithium4`
+- `qteslapi`
comment.body: Yes, this was an oversight that I just fixed.

pull_request.title: Overhauled test suite.
pull_request.body: The speed tests have been temporarily taken out the CI. Once, `openssl speed` can parse OQS key-exchanges in the form of the names given [here](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/blob/OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable/oqs-template/generate.yml#L3), a parallelized version of the KEM and SIG tests can be added to a nightly build.
